views.name: Default view
views.description: The default view of the data.

views.name: Centrosome
views.description: Centrosome of a wild-type HeLa cell, as described in Fig. 2b of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Golgi Stack
views.description: Golgi Stack of a wild-type HeLa cell, as described in Fig. 2c of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Nuclear envelope with polyribosomes
views.description: Nuclear envelope with polyribosomes of a wild-type HeLa cell, as described in Fig. 2d of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Refined, whole-cell predictions
views.description: Renderings of refined predictions for multiple organelles, as presented in Fig. 2e of Heinrich et al., 2020

views.name: Holdout block used for evaluation
views.description: Manually annotated block used for evaluation of machine learning classifiers along with corresponding predictions, as described in Supplementary Data 2 of Heinrich et al., 2020.

views.name: Plasma membrane and nucleus size filtering
views.description: A number of refinements were made to the initial machine learning predictions. A description of each type of refinement can be found in Heinrich et al., 2020. In the nucles and plasma membrane segmentations displayed here, every voxel is assigned a label based on whether it is background or part of an organelle. Background voxels are assigned a value of 0, and organelle voxels are assigned IDs that are unique to each individual organelle. A minimum size filter was applicated to the connected components in order to eliminate small false positives. The size of the filter was conservavatue based on the expected organelle size.
